chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew J. Bae was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Drive or Operate w/o Consent-Abandon Veh, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).
  • Negligent Operation of Motor Vehicle, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Costs are payable at the rate of $100.00 per month, starting December 1, 2015 and on the same day thereafter each month, until paid in full.    Failure to pay any part of the court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.
May apply for expungement, if he successfully completes this sentence.

records.addlTxt: DA Gerald Fox appears for the State. Defendant appeared in person, in custody with Attorney Sherman.  Plead no contest to all counts in the amended complaint.  Victim notification requirements met.  Restitution paid in full to the State.   Court advised the charge and possible penalties of the counts he plead to.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, elements and constitutional rights waived with the Defendant.  He understood.  Defense stipulated to a factual basis for the plea.  Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his plea, and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found defendant guilty, as plead to.  Joint recommendation for time served.  90 days jail.  Credit for 84 days.  Defendant did not elect to exercise his right to allocution.  Court ordered:  90 days jail, credit for 84 days served, concurrent.  CC. DNA sample and surcharge.  Pay @ $100/mo starting 12/1/15.    Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid. May apply for expungement, if he successfully completes this sentence.
ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Attorney Sherman appeared.  Working on an agreement.  Defendant is in custody on this charge.  Set plea/sentencing 10/26/15 at 1:30 pm

Pre-trial conference at 09-09-2015 10:00 am.
Status conference at 09-28-2015 03:00 pm.
Court questioned defendant on his understanding of the waiver of time limits.  He understands.  Court finds the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived time limits for the preliminary hearing.
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Jon Sherman.  Waive reading of complaint.    PTC 9/9/15 and STC 9/28/15 at 3 pm
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
Until further order of the court you shall not leave the State of Wisconsin, without permission of the court.  Defendant must keep the court updated on his current mailing address.

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the jail.  Attorney Sherman appeared in person.  Defendant received the complaint, but did not read it.  Court recited the charges and possible penalties.  Defendant understood.  AIA set for 8/17/15 at 9:30 am.  Bond set.
